main.controllers

Class OrganizerController

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.controllers.UserController
      • main.controllers.AttendeeController
        • main.controllers.OrganizerController

  • public class OrganizerController
extends AttendeeController
    Apart from the responsibilities listed in the UserController, the OrganizerController handles advance actions which could be done by an organizer: checking and managing events, creating speaker accounts, and creating rooms.
    Since:
    2020-11-10
    Version:
    2.1
    Author:
    Ruoming Ren

        public boolean createEvent(java.lang.String title,
                           java.time.LocalDateTime time,
                           int roomNum,
                           int duration,
                           int capacity,
                           java.lang.String type)
        Build an event by giving the title, time, room ID, and speaker ID. The room must already exist.
        Parameters:
        title - the title of the event
        time - the time of the event
        roomNum - the roomNum of the event
        duration - the duration of the event
        capacity - the capacity of the event
        type - the type of the event
        Returns:
        true if the event be created successfully.

      • updateTime

        public boolean updateTime(java.lang.String eventId,
                          java.time.LocalDateTime time)
        Update the time of the event
        Parameters:
        eventId - the uuid of the event
        time - the new time of the event
        Returns:
        true if the event's time have been successfully update or the new time has no difference with the old time. Return false if the new time is conflict with other event and the time haven't been successfully updated.
